results.title: Versatility in glass
results.brief_description:
Public relations film outlining the nature of glass: how it is made; how it can be used in its many and varied forms for decoration, safety and protection in the home, industry and transportation.
Suitable for upper primary and lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: For Better - For Worse
results.creator_credit: John M. Bale, Don Anderson and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Dramatization of common misconceptions surrounding marriage and the types of stress contributing to marriage breakdown. Refers to alcohol, the consequences of “mateship” and violence.

results.title: The Legend of Sleepy Hollow
results.creator_credit: Sam Weiss, Nick Bosustow, David Adams and Pyramid Films
results.brief_description: Visualizes the spectral spirits and twilight superstitions that haunted the drowsy Dutch settlement of Sleepy Hollow. Concerns the rivalry between Ichabod Crane and Brom Bones for the hand of Katrina Van Tassel, and how the Headless Horseman of Sleepy Hollow removes Ichabod from the scene. Screenplay by Joseph Cavella, based on the story by Washington Irving. Narrated by John Carradine.

results.title: Shearing Yaks (Tajik People)
results.creator_credit: Hermann Schlenker, Julien Bryan and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mountain peoples of Central Asia”.
Explains how the yak herds, which stay high in the mountains, where it is cool, are brought down to the village for shearing. The wool is pounded by men with sticks, spun into yarn and kept until there is enough to make a carpet. Shows the Tajik people shearing yaks.

results.title: Afghanistan, Pushtun people: making felt
results.creator_credit: Hermann Schlenker, Julien Bryan and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Mountain peoples of Central Asia”.
Shows how women of the Pushtun tribe make felt mats for their families and for decorating the hard floor of their black camel-hair tents. Suitable for upper primary, lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: Boys' game: Pushtu nomads
results.creator_credit: Hermann Schlenker and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mountain peoples of Central Asia”.
Shows an ancient game, well-known in Asia, being played by Pushtu boys. Demonstrates the toughness of the young men and the value these tribal people place on physical superiority. Suitable for upper primary and lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: Southeast Asia: a culture history
results.creator_credit: Arthur Niehoff and Sigma Educational Films
results.brief_description: Explains the cultures of Vietnam, Laos, Cambodia and Thailand as a blend of indigenous tribal traditions and the high culture of Hindu-Buddhist India. Discusses how former centres of empire stand as testimony to the endurance of Buddhist and Brahman idea systems in Southeast Asia. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

Discusses how former centres of empire stand as testimony to the endurance of Buddhist and Brahman idea systems in Southeast Asia. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Cyclone = Ciclon
results.creator_credit: Santiago Alvarez and Instituto Cubano del Arte e Industrias Cinematográficos (ICAIC)
results.brief_description: A non-narrated film showing the havoc caused by the cyclone which hit the western provinces of Cuba in October, 1963. Reveals the tragic consequences for the poor peasants and also shows the care taken of the injured and the homeless.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Santiago Alvarez and Instituto Cubano del Arte e Industrias Cinematográficos (ICAIC)

results.title: Fingers of gold
results.creator_credit: Banana Growers Federation and Kingcroft Productions
results.brief_description: Illustrates banana production and distribution in New South Wales. Provides information on such aspects as irrigation, protection from the cold, pests and fungus, harvesting, packing and controlled ripening.
